header.title: School forced to apologise for requesting ‘white British’ taxi driver for pupils
header.postText: A school catering for children with special needs has been forced to apologise after asking for a ‘white British’ taxi driver to transport pupils.', 'Highfield School in Ossett, West Yorkshire sent the request to a Castleford taxi company to set up a regular service for one of its students.', 'The email read: ‘Unfortunately our student will not tolerate anybody who is not white British, therefore to safeguard your drivers please could you always send a white British driver.’', 'Taxi drivers at the company – who asked not to be named – were ‘shocked’ at the request which they said was ‘borderline racist’ and insensitive.', 'A spokesman for the firm said: ‘When I received that letter I was shocked because it came from a school where they are supposed to be teaching about equality and diversity and that’s what we’re supposed to be teaching the next generation.', '‘If you allow this request to be made by the pupil or the parent you’re not promoting that.', '‘It’s racist and we’ve never had a request like this before.’', 'Wajid Ali, co-chair of Wakefield District Private Hire and Hackney Association, said a meeting was held with its 500 members who were ‘all very upset’ over the request.', 'Ali said: ‘We can’t believe a public body has the audacity to send a letter like this.', '‘We’re all really upset about it. It goes against the Race Relations Act 2000 which encourages public bodies not to discriminate against any group. The school should have had this policy in place.', '‘We have had people say to us “what about the pupil’s complex needs?” but a child under 16 would not be able to make that decision. This was a decision taken by the school.’', 'Ali added that in his 14 years as a taxi driver, this is the first time anything like this has happened and feels they have been discriminated against.', 'He said: ‘We consider ourselves as professional taxi drivers and certainly I would never judge my customers on their ethnicity.', '‘We treat everybody equally and in this case the school has not treated the drivers equally.', '‘It’s borderline racist. Race and colour should not come into it. We live in a multicultural society that promotes diversity.', '‘We were born in this country and we’re just people trying to provide a paying service and look after our families.’', 'Peter Marshall, executive headteacher of Highfield School, said: ‘We fully acknowledge that the email sent by the school was wholly inappropriate and we apologise for any offence that was caused.', '‘Our priority is to support our pupils, many of whom have extremely challenging and complex needs.', '‘Over 180 children from our school community use minibuses and taxis to enable them to access the highly specialised teaching and care we are able to provide for them. We very much value and appreciate the service that all taxi companies and their drivers provide.', '‘We have contacted the taxi company to apologise and explain the challenges and needs faced by the pupil the request related to.’
